intro: [WRONG START] Hieracussion ulosfjordense, commonly known as the Ulvafjord Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of northern Scandinavia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky and barren soils, thriving in cold, harsh environments. Its leaves are usually basal, with a rough, hairy texture, and its flowers are yellow, appearing in late summer. Hieracium ulosfjordense is adapted to low temperatures and has a short growing season, making it a rare and specialized species.
